intro: Trithuria konkanensis, commonly known as the Konkan Trithuria, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its submerged or floating aquatic growth habit. The plant typically has slender, ribbon-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often borne in clusters. It thrives in freshwater environments such as lakes, ponds, and slow-moving streams. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
